metadata.description: Determines which of the 4 upsell strategies (Classic, Menu, Anchor, or Rollover) best fits your business model

questions.text: How would you describe your current customer base?
questions.help_text: Select the option that best reflects your active customer situation
questions.why_this_matters: Different upsell strategies work better depending on whether you're building a new customer base or optimizing an existing one. Rollover upsells excel with established customers, while Classic and Menu upsells work great for growing businesses.

options.label: New Business (Few Customers)
options.description: Just starting out, building my first customer base

options.label: Growing Customer Base
options.description: Steady stream of new customers, some repeat buyers

options.label: Established Customer Base
options.description: Large pool of existing customers with purchase history

options.label: Many Dormant/Past Customers
options.description: Have customers who haven't purchased recently

questions.text: How many products or service tiers do you currently offer?
questions.help_text: Think about your complete product catalog
questions.why_this_matters: Menu Upsells require multiple products to prescribe from. Anchor Upsells need the ability to create premium tiers. Classic Upsells can work with any portfolio size.

options.label: Single Product/Service
options.description: I sell one main thing

options.label: 2-3 Products/Tiers
options.description: Small curated selection

options.label: 4-10 Products/Tiers
options.description: Moderate product range

options.label: 10+ Products/Tiers
options.description: Extensive catalog to choose from

questions.text: What is your current average order value?
questions.help_text: Select the range closest to what customers typically pay
questions.why_this_matters: Anchor Upsells work best at higher price points (5-10x premium means you need room to scale). Rollover Upsells require significant previous purchase value to credit. Classic and Menu work at any price point.

options.label: Under $50
options.description: Low-ticket offers
Mid-ticket range
Higher-ticket products
High-ticket offers
Premium high-ticket

questions.text: Do you have a 'card on file' system for easy upsell purchases?
questions.help_text: Can customers buy additional products without re-entering payment info?
questions.why_this_matters: Menu Upsells rely heavily on 'card on file' capability to maximize take rates. Having payment info stored makes upselling seamless and increases conversion dramatically.

options.label: Yes - Card on File System
options.description: Customers can buy more with one click

options.label: No, But Can Implement Easily
options.description: Have the tech stack, just need to turn it on

options.label: Would Need to Build This
options.description: Don't currently have this capability

options.label: No Plans to Implement
options.description: Prefer manual payment collection

questions.text: Can you easily create premium or deluxe versions of your current offers?
questions.help_text: Think about whether you could 5-10x your product's value
questions.why_this_matters: Anchor Upsells require a premium version at 5-10x the price of your main offer. If you can't create a legitimate premium tier, Anchor won't work well for you.

options.label: Already Have Premium Versions
options.description: I offer deluxe/VIP tiers at higher prices

options.label: Can Create Premium Easily
options.description: I know exactly what premium would include

options.label: Would Be Challenging
options.description: Not sure how to make premium version worth 5-10x

options.label: Not Possible for My Business
options.description: My product can't be tiered this way

questions.text: Can you track each customer's complete purchase history?
questions.help_text: Do you know what every customer has bought from you and when?
questions.why_this_matters: Rollover Upsells require detailed tracking of previous purchases so you can credit them toward the next offer. Without this, you can't execute Rollover strategy effectively.

options.label: Full Purchase History Tracking
options.description: I know exactly what each customer has purchased

options.label: Partial Tracking
options.description: I track some purchases but not all details

options.label: Minimal Tracking
options.description: Basic records only
examples: Know who bought, but not details

options.label: No Purchase History Tracking
options.description: Don't currently track customer purchase history

questions.text: What is your PRIMARY goal for adding an upsell?
questions.why_this_matters: Different upsell types excel at different goals. Classic maximizes immediate profit, Menu builds LTV through right-fit products, Anchor increases AOV, and Rollover re-engages past customers.

options.label: Maximize Immediate Profit Per Sale
options.description: Get the most money right now from each customer

options.label: Increase Customer Lifetime Value
options.description: Build long-term customer relationships and revenue

options.label: Re-engage Dormant/Past Customers
options.description: Win back customers who haven't purchased recently

options.label: Attract Competitor's Upset Customers
options.description: Win over people unhappy with competitors

questions.text: How sophisticated are your customers about buying decisions?
questions.help_text: How much do they know about your industry and solutions?
questions.why_this_matters: Menu Upsells (especially the Unselling tactic) work best with sophisticated buyers who appreciate being told what they DON'T need. Anchor Upsells require customers who can appreciate premium value.

options.label: Very Sophisticated
options.description: They know the space well, appreciate expert guidance

options.label: Moderately Sophisticated
options.description: Have some knowledge, open to recommendations

options.label: Beginners/Novices
options.description: New to the space, need guidance

options.label: Primarily Price Shoppers
options.description: Main concern is getting the best deal

questions.text: Where do most of your sales happen?
questions.why_this_matters: Classic Upsells work on both front-end and back-end. Menu Upsells excel in live/call settings where you can prescribe. Anchor Upsells work well in sales calls. Rollover can work anywhere.

options.label: Automated Online Funnel
options.description: Self-serve checkout, minimal human interaction

options.label: Sales Calls/Appointments
options.description: I talk to customers before they buy

options.label: Email/Backend Offers
options.description: Upsell after initial purchase via email

options.label: Hybrid Approach
options.description: Mix of automated and human touchpoints

questions.text: What is your current upsell situation?
questions.help_text: Be honest about where you are now
questions.why_this_matters: If you have no upsell, Classic is the fastest to implement. If upsells are failing, you might be offering the wrong thing, at the wrong time, or in the wrong way - Menu can fix this. If you need to rescue the situation, Rollover helps recover.

options.label: No Upsell Currently
options.description: I only sell my main product, nothing more

options.label: Have Upsell - Working OK
options.description: Have an upsell, decent results, want to optimize

options.label: Have Upsell - Not Working Well
options.description: Tried upselling but poor conversion rates

options.label: Have Upset/Churned Customers
options.description: Need to rescue customer relationships

scoring_notes.classic_upsell: Scores highest for businesses wanting immediate profit boost, have seamless infrastructure, work on front-end or back-end, and don't have upsells yet. 80%+ take rate when done right.
scoring_notes.menu_upsell: Scores highest for businesses with multiple products, sophisticated customers, card on file, sales calls, and want to build LTV. Hormozi's favorite - unselling builds trust.
scoring_notes.anchor_upsell: Scores highest for businesses that can create premium tiers at 5-10x price, higher AOV, sales calls, sophisticated buyers. Creates price anchoring effect.
scoring_notes.rollover_upsell: Scores highest for businesses with established customer base, full tracking, dormant customers to re-engage, or upset customers to rescue. Credits previous purchases toward next offer at 4x+ value.
